variable.name: DSNLOAD
variable.label: DSNLOAD
variable.description: The name of the main APF-authorized DB2 load module library that is to be used by installation and sample jobs.

variable.name: DSNEXIT
variable.label: DSNEXIT
variable.description: The name of the main APF-authorized DB2 load module library that is to be used by installation and sample jobs.

variable.name: MVSSNAME
variable.label: MVSSNAME
variable.description: The z/OS subsystem name for DB2.

variable.name: PROGNAME
variable.label: PROGNAME
variable.description: The name of the program to execute dynamic queries, e.g. DSNTEP2.

variable.name: PLANNAME
variable.label: PLANNAME
variable.description: The name of the plan for the program to execute dynamic queries, e.g. DSNTEPB1.

variable.name: RUNLIB
variable.label: RUNLIB
variable.description: The name of the DB2 sample application load module library.

variable.name: SQLID
variable.label: SQLID
variable.description: User name of DBADM of the DATABASE.

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.label: USERNAME
variable.description: User name of DBADM of the DATABASE.

variable.name: DBNAME
variable.label: Database name
variable.abstract: The name of the database to be restored from
variable.description: The name of the database to be restored from

variable.name: SCHEMANAME
variable.label: Schema name
variable.abstract: The schema name of backup data objects
variable.description: The name of the schema under which the backup data objects are created

variable.name: CONTEXTNAME
variable.label: CONTEXTNAME
variable.description: The name of the trusted context to be created.

variable.name: REMOTECONTEXTNAME
variable.label: REMOTECONTEXTNAME
variable.description: The name of the remote trusted context to be created.

variable.name: CLIENTIPADDRESS
variable.label: CLIENTIPADDRESS
variable.abstract: Client IP Address of Trusted Context
variable.description: The client ip address to be added into the remote trusted context to be created.

variable.name: ROLENAME
variable.label: ROLENAME
variable.description: The name of the rule to be created and to be granted with the privilege.

variable.name: LTCUSERNAME
variable.label: LTCUSERNAME
variable.description: The DB2 user name who can use the the trusted context.

variable.name: RMTUSERNAME
variable.label: RMTUSERNAME
variable.description: The DB2 user name who can build the connection of the remote trusted context.

variable.name: RMTUSER
variable.label: RMTUSER
variable.description: The DB2 user name who can use the connection of the remote trusted context.

variable.name: RMTDISTID
variable.label: RMTDISTID
variable.description: The user name of distributed identity that maps to a RACF ID.

variable.name: RMTDISTREG
variable.label: RMTDISTREG
variable.description: The registry name that contains the distributed identify user name.

variable.name: RACFOWNER
variable.label: RACFOWNER
variable.description: The name of the owner of the RACF group to be created.

variable.name: RACFSUPERGRP
variable.label: RACFSUPERGRP
variable.description: The name of the RACF super group of the RACF group to be created.

variable.name: RACFGROUP
variable.label: RACFGROUP
variable.description: The name of the RACF group to be created.

variable.name: RACFUSER
variable.label: RACFUSER
variable.description: The name of the RACF user to be created.

variable.name: objTransRestore
variable.label: objTransRestore
variable.description: Object translate for restore

variable.name: listdefRestore
variable.label: listdefBackup
variable.description: listdef definition for restore

variable.name: steplib
variable.label: STEPLIB DD
variable.description: steplib: It must include //STEPLIB at the begining of the line. It at least must include ADB, GOC, and SDSNLOAD libraries. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: genplan
variable.label: Admin Plan
variable.description: plan: Plan name of Admin tool

variable.name: genparms
variable.label: ADB2GEN Params
variable.description: genparms: Comma delimited ADB2GEN parameters. REBIND: will generate REBIND statement. NOGEN: will not Generate DDL. This parameter is specified when only catalog statistics is needed. GENSTATS: will generate catalog statistics for applicable genestats parameters.

variable.name: tgtdsn
variable.label: Target System DSN name
variable.abstract: Name of the target system DSN name
variable.description: tgtdsn: Name of the target system DSN name

variable.name: sqldd
variable.label: GEN output dataset DD
variable.description: sqldd: Complete DD of SQL DD. See examples variable input file.

variable.name: masksdd
variable.label: GEN mask dataset DD
variable.description: masks: Complete DD of MASKS DD. See examples variable input file.

variable.name: sqlddbak
variable.label: GEN output dataset DD
variable.description: sqldd: Complete DD of SQL DD. See examples variable input file.

variable.name: db2sys
variable.label: DB2 SYS
variable.description: db2sys: SSID of DB2

variable.name: db2aloc
variable.label: DB2 Aloc
variable.description: db2aloc: Default value is blank

variable.name: db2serv
variable.label: DB2 Server Location
variable.description: db2serv: DB2 Server Location

variable.name: db2auth
variable.label: DB2 Authorization ID
variable.description: db2auth: DB2 Authorization ID

variable.name: db2rel
variable.label: DB2 Release Version
variable.description: db2rel: 4 digits DB2 Release Version

variable.name: gensg
variable.label: Generate Stogroup
variable.description: gensg: Option Y or N to generate database DDL

variable.name: gendb
variable.label: Generate Database
variable.description: gendb: Option Y or N to generate database DDL

variable.name: gents
variable.label: Generate Tablespace
variable.description: gents: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: gentable
variable.label: Generate Table
variable.description: gentable: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genview
variable.label: Generate View
variable.description: genview: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genindex
variable.label: Generate Index
variable.description: genindex: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: gensyn
variable.label: Generate Synomym
variable.description: gensyn: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genalias
variable.label: Generate Alias
variable.description: genalias: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genlable
variable.label: Generate label
variable.description: genlable: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: gencomm
variable.label: Generate comment
variable.description: gencomm: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genrels
variable.label: Generate relation
variable.description: genrels: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: gentrig
variable.label: Generate trigger
variable.description: gentrig: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: actvcntl
variable.label: Generate active control
variable.abstract: Option to generate ALTER TABLE..ACTIVATE ROW/COLUMN ACCESS CONTROL statement.
variable.description: actvcntl: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: pendchgs
variable.label: Generate pending change
variable.description: pendchgs: Y, A, O, or N must be specified. 'Y' to Merges pending changes (in SYSPENDINGDDL) into CREATE statements, 'A' to Generates DDL for pending changes as ALTER statements, 'O' to Generates only pending changes as ALTER statements, 'N' to Generates pending changes as SQL comments

variable.name: genmask
variable.label: Generate mask control
variable.description: genmask: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genperm
variable.label: Generate permission
variable.description: genperm: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genudt
variable.label: Generate user defined type
variable.abstract: Option to generate user defined type
variable.description: genudt: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genudf
variable.label: Generate user defined function
variable.abstract: Option to generate user defined function
variable.description: genudt: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genstp
variable.label: Generate stored procedure
variable.description: genstp: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genseq
variable.label: Generate sequence
variable.description: genstp: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: genvar
variable.label: Generate global variable
variable.description: genvar: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantdb
variable.label: Generate grant database
variable.description: grantdb: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantts
variable.label: Generate grant tablespace
variable.description: grantts: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: granttab
variable.label: Generate grant table
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to table
variable.description: granttab: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantvw
variable.label: Generate grant view
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to view
variable.description: grantvw: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantsch
variable.label: Generate grant schema
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to schema
variable.description: grantsch: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantudt
variable.label: Generate grant user defined type
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to user defined type
variable.description: grantudt: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantudf
variable.label: Generate grant view
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to user defined function
variable.description: grantudf: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantstp
variable.label: Generate grant stored procedure
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to stored procedure
variable.description: grantstp: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantseq
variable.label: Generate grant view
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to sequence
variable.description: grantseq: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: grantvar
variable.label: Generate grant global variable
variable.abstract: Option to generate grant to global variable
variable.description: grantvw: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: implqualmethod
variable.label: Implicit qualification method
variable.description: implqualmethod: O, C or Blank must be specified. This is used to determine implicit qualifiers for views. This parameter is used to inform GEN which SET CURRENT SQLID to use for views created prior to DB2V9 that has unqualified aliases or synonyms whose names match the referred to tables. 'O' (default, original) to Use the qualifier of the table. 'C' (computed) to use the qualifier from set of possible candidates.

variable.name: grantsg
variable.label: Generate grant Stogroup
variable.description: grantsg: Y or N must be specified

variable.name: impldb
variable.label: Generate implict database
variable.description: impldb: Y, N or blank

variable.name: implts
variable.label: Generate implict tablespace
variable.description: implts: Specify Y to generate

variable.name: fromdb
variable.label: Source database name
variable.description: fromdb: source database name

variable.name: fromsch
variable.label: Source creator
variable.description: fromsch: source creator

variable.name: newdb
variable.label: Database name
variable.abstract: The name of the database to be restored to
variable.description: The name of the database to be restored to

variable.name: newtssg
variable.label: Generate new tablespace stogroup
variable.abstract: Option to generate new tablespace stogroup
variable.description: newtssg: Specify new stogroup name for tablespace for generated SQL (override table space stogroup name)

variable.name: newixsg
variable.label: Generate new stogroup name for index
variable.abstract: Generate new stogroup name for index
variable.description: newixsg: Specify new stogroup name for index for generated SQL (override index stogroup name)

variable.name: newsch
variable.label: Schema name
variable.abstract: The name of the schema under which the data objects are restored
variable.description: The name of the schema under which the data objects are restored

variable.name: newsqlid
variable.label: SQLID
variable.abstract: New SQLID to restore the data objects
variable.description: New SQLID to restore the data objects

variable.name: newgrantor
variable.label: Generate new grantor
variable.description: newgrantor: Specify new grantor for generated SQL (Override GRANTOR)

variable.name: spcalloc
variable.label: space allocation
variable.description: spcalloc: DEFINED, USED, or ALLOC. Default is DEFINED. This parameter is used to specify how to generate the primary quantity of tablespaces and indexes(sysindexpart.pqty and systablepart.pqty)

variable.name: gscoldist
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLDIST
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLDIST
variable.description: gscoldist: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLDISTSTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLDISTSTATS
variable.description: gscoldiststats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLSTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLSTATS
variable.description: gscolstats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gscolumns
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSCOLUMNS

variable.description: gscolumns: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.description: gsindexes: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSINDEXPART

variable.description: gsindexpart: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSINDEXSTATS

variable.description: gsindexstats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSLOBSTATS

variable.description: gslobstats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLEPAR
variable.description: gstablepart: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gstables
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLES
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLES
variable.description: gstables: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gstablespace
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLESPACE
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLESPACE
variable.description: gstablespace: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gstabstats
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABSTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABSTATS
variable.description: gstabstats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gsroutines
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSROUTINES
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSROUTINES
variable.description: gsroutines: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gsindexspacestats
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSINDEXSPACESTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSINDEXSPACESTATS
variable.description: gsindexspacestats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLESPACESTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSTABLESPACESTATS
variable.description: gstablespacestats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTARGETSTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTARGETSTATS
variable.description: gskeytargetstats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gskeytgtdist
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTGTDIST
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTGTDIST
variable.description: gskeytgtdist: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: gskeytgtdiststats
variable.label: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTGTDISTSTATS
variable.abstract: Option to generate statistics of SYSKEYTGTDISTSTATS
variable.description: gskeytgtdiststats: Specify Y to generate statistics. Default value is Y.

variable.name: rolewarn
variable.label: Role warning
variable.description: rolewarn: Specify Y to issue warning message of creating an object with a role

variable.name: getdb2zp
variable.label: Get DB2 ZPARMS
variable.description: getdb2zp: Y or N must be specified. Indiactes whether to Get DB2 ZPARM or not.

variable.name: tgtdb2
variable.label: Output target DB2
variable.description: tgtdb2: Output DB2 Version

variable.name: objnames
variable.label: Object Names
variable.abstract: Name of the objects to be reverse engineered.
variable.description: objnames: Name of the objects to be reverse engineered. See variable input file for examples. The line must not exceed 72 chars limit.

variable.name: steplibdd
variable.label: STEPLIB DD
variable.description: steplibdd: It must include //STEPLIB at the begining of the line. It at least must include ADB, GOC, and SDSNLOAD libraries. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: sysexecdd
variable.label: SYSEXEC DD
variable.description: sysexecdd: It must include //SYSEXEC at the begining of the line. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: msglibdd
variable.label: MSGLIB DD
variable.description: msglibdd: It must include //MSGLIB at the begining of the line. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: adbalibdd
variable.label: ADBALIB DD
variable.description: msglibdd: It must include //ADBALIB at the begining of the line. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: db2rlibdd
variable.label: DB2RLIB DD
variable.description: msglibdd: It must include //DB2RLIB at the begining of the line. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: system
variable.label: System name
variable.description: System SSID name

variable.name: tepplan
variable.label: Plan name
variable.description: ADBTEP2 plan name

variable.name: lib
variable.label: Library DSN name
variable.description: DSN where ADBTEP2 library is stored

variable.name: adbdiagdd
variable.label: ADBDIAG DD
variable.description: msglibdd: It must include //ADBDIAG at the begining of the line. Specify //ADBDIAG DD DUMMY you do not use it. See example input variable file how to specify multiple lines

variable.name: ssid
variable.label: SSID name
variable.abstract: SSID name of the DB2 subsystem
variable.description: SSID name of the DB2 subsystem

variable.name: maxe
variable.label: DSN command max error
variable.abstract: number of DSN commands that can fail
variable.description: The value for maxerrors specifies the number of DSN commands that can fail before the ADBTEP2 processing is stopped: -1 All DSN errors are ignored. The job is not stopped for any error. 0 No DSN errors are ignored. The job is stopped on the first error. This is the default value. 1-99 The specified number of DSN errors are ignored. The job is stopped on the nth + 1 error.

variable.name: binderror
variable.label: Bind error handling
variable.abstract: number of DSN commands that can fail
variable.description: The BINDERROR setting controls how failing BIND or REBIND commands are handled: MAXE - The MAXERROR setting determines if the processing stops immediately, after nn errors or if the bind error does not stop processing. This is the default setting. IGNORE - Processing continues.

variable.name: ac
variable.label: Auto Check option
variable.description: The AUTOCHECK parameter controls if the automatic check pending resolution process is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run: YES - The automatic check pending resolution process will be performed. NO - The automatic check pending resolution process will not be performed.

variable.name: autorebuild
variable.label: Auto rebuild option
variable.description: The Auto Rebuild parameter controls if an automatic REBUILD is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run when an index is in certain rebuild pending states: YES - An automatic REBUILD will be performed (default). NO - An automatic REBUILD will be not performed.

variable.name: autoreorg
variable.label: Auto reorg option
variable.description: The Auto Reorg parameter controls if an automatic REORG is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run when a table space is in certain reorg pending states(1): YES - An automatic REORG will be performed (default). NO - An automatic REORG will be not performed.

variable.name: advisoryautorebuild
variable.label: Advisory Auto Rebuild option
variable.description: The Auto Rebuild parameter controls if an Advisory Auto Rebuild is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run when an index is in certain rebuild pending states: YES - An automatic REBUILD will be performed. NO - An automatic REBUILD will be not performed (default).

variable.name: advisoryautoreorg
variable.label: Auto reorg option
variable.description: The Advisory Auto Reorg parameter controls if an automatic REORG is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run when a table space is in certain reorg pending states: YES - An automatic REORG will be performed. NO - An automatic REORG will be not performed (default).

variable.name: admunllobxml
variable.label: ADMIN UNLOAD LOB/XML Image Copy option
variable.abstract: ADMIN UNLOAD LOB/XML Image Copy option
variable.description: The LOB/XML IC Unload parameter controls the behavior of ADMIN UNLOAD TABLESPACE statements if an unload from an image copy of a table space is requested and any table in that table space contains LOB or XML columns: E - ADBTEP2 should end with an error. U - An unload of the base object should be performed instead (default).

variable.name: admunlnoic
variable.label: ADMIN UNLOAD Image Copy option
variable.description: The Missing IC Unload parameter controls the behavior of ADMIN UNLOAD TABLESPACE statements if an unload from an image copy of a table space is requested and no image copy can be found: E - ADBTEP2 should end with an error. U - An unload of the base object should be performed instead (default).

variable.name: spanned
variable.label: SPANNED option for UNLOAD
variable.description: The Spanned parameter controls if the SPANNED YES clause is added to the DB2 UNLOAD statement to unload data into a RECFM=VBS data set. YES - SPANNED YES is added to the UNLOAD statement. NO - SPANNED YES is not added to the UNLOAD statement (default).

variable.name: pendingchangescheck
variable.label: DB2 Pending Changes options
variable.description: The Check at DROP parameter controls if a check is made to avoid losing any DB2 pending changes as part of the DROP action: YES - The DROP is not performed if a DB2 pending change exists (default). NO - The DROP is performed without checking for pending changes.

variable.name: stogroupautoreor
variable.label: Auto Reorg/Rebuild after STOGROUP
variable.description: The Auto Reorg/Rebuild after STOGROUP change parameter controls if an automatic REORG or REBUILD is performed as part of the ADBTEP2 run after ALTER STOGROUP statement is executed for the table space or index: YES - An automatic REORG or REBUILD will be performed (default). NO - An automatic REORG will be not performed.

variable.name: ddlin
variable.label: DDL DSN name
variable.abstract: Dataset name of the input DDL
variable.description: Dataset name of the input DDL

variable.name: DSNZPARM
variable.label: Source Db2 ZPARM Module
variable.abstract: ZPARM module name of the source Db2
variable.description: DSNZPARM: The ZPARM module name for the soure Db2.

variable.name: tgtdb2ssid
variable.label: Target Db2
variable.description: tgtdb2: The SSID for the Target Db2.

variable.name: srcSCKZLOAD
variable.label: Source SCKZLOAD
variable.description: srcSCKZLOAD: This is the Cloning Tool load library (SCKZLOAD). It will be used in the STEPLIB of the Cloning Tool Source job.

variable.name: tgtSCKZLOAD
variable.label: Target SCKZLOAD
variable.description: tgtSCKZLOAD: This is the Cloning Tool load library (SCKZLOAD). It will be used in the STEPLIB of the Cloning Tool Source job.

variable.name: srcCKZINI
variable.label: Source CKZINI Library
variable.abstract: The source library and member name for the Cloning Tool Initialization Parameters
variable.description: srcCKZINI: This is the dataset name for the Cloning tool initialization parameters in the form of the library and member name {dataset-name(ckzini-member)}

variable.name: tgtCKZINI
variable.label: Target CKZINI Library
variable.abstract: The target library and member name for the Cloning Tool Initialization Parameters
variable.description: tgtCKZINI: This is the dataset name for the Cloning tool initialization parameters in the form of the library and member name {dataset-name(ckzini-member)}

variable.name: CKZPlan
variable.label: Cloning Tool Plan
variable.description: CKZPlan: Plan name of Cloning Tool

variable.name: syncdb2dsn
variable.label: CKZ SYNCDB2 dataset
variable.description: syncdb2dsn: Library name used to synchronize between Source and Target jobs. No member specified here. See Cloning Tool Processing Parms for the Member.

variable.name: ddloutdsn
variable.label: CKZ DDLOUT library name
variable.description: ddloutdsn: The Source job writes DDL for objects created at the Target. No member specified here. See Cloning Tool Processing Parms for the Member.

variable.name: logapplydsn
variable.label: CKZ Log Apply library name
variable.description: logapplydsn: Target job Log Apply dataset. Needed in Source job if the Source in an image copy. No member specified here. See Cloning Tool Processing Parms for the Member.

variable.name: srcTCPIPport
variable.label: CKZ Source TCPIP Server
variable.description: srcTCPIPport: This is the port that the Target job will use to connect to the Source Db2 when crossing LPARs fied here. See Cloning Tool Processing Parms for the Member.

variable.name: tgtTCPIPport
variable.label: CKZ Target TCPIP Server
variable.description: tgtTCPIPport: This is the port that the Source job will use to connect to the Target Db2 when crossing LPARs fied here. See Cloning Tool Processing Parms for the Member.

variable.name: srcLPAR
variable.label: Source LPAR
variable.description: srcLPAR: The Source LPAR associated with the Source Db2.

variable.name: tgtLPAR
variable.label: Target LPAR
variable.description: tgtLPAR: The Target LPAR associated with the Target Db2.

variable.name: srcdb2
variable.label: Source Db2
variable.description: srcdb2: The SSID for the Source Db2.

variable.name: srcZPARM
variable.label: Source Db2 ZPARM Module
variable.abstract: ZPARM module name of the source Db2
variable.description: srcZPARM: The ZPARM module name for the soure Db2.

variable.name: srcBSDS1
variable.label: Source Db2 BSDS01
variable.description: srcBSDS1: The BSDS01 dataset for the Source Db2.

variable.name: srcBSDS2
variable.label: Source Db2 BSDS02
variable.description: srcBSDS2: The BSDS02 dataset for the Source Db2.

variable.name: srcVCAT
variable.label: Source Db2 VCAT
variable.description: srcVCAT: The VCAT HLQ for the Source Db2.

variable.name: tgtVCAT
variable.label: Target Db2 VCAT
variable.description: tgtVCAT: The VCAT HLQ for the Target Db2.

variable.name: dsn_Member
variable.label: Processing libraries Member Name
variable.abstract: Member name used for processing datasets
variable.description: dsn_Member: Lirabry member name for syncdb2dsn, ddloutdsn, and logapplydsn data sets.

variable.name: simulate
variable.label: Simulate
variable.abstract: Should the Source job be run in Simulate mode?
variable.description: simulate: SIM(Y) can be used to test that the LISTDEF definition works properly. Data is not cloned. Consider setting DDL Processing to N (in Target Object Parms), and Data Mover Pgm to NONE for a simulation.

variable.name: dataMoverPgm
variable.label: Data Mover Pgm
variable.abstract: Determines how the data should be cloned.
variable.description: dataMoverPgm: Only ADRDSSU or NONE is support now, but more will be added.

variable.name: fastrep
variable.label: Fast Replication
variable.description: fastrep: Determines whether Fast Replication is required or preferred, or not to be used.

variable.name: fctopprcprimary
variable.label: Mirroring Preservation
variable.description: fctopprcprimary: Determines if target volumes can be placed in a long busy state during the COPY operation if mirroring is in effect.

variable.name: remoteConnType
variable.label: Remote Connect Type
variable.description: remoteConnType: Only CAF is support, but DDF and TCPIP options will follow.

variable.name: fuzzycopy
variable.label: Cloning Fuzzy Copy Option
variable.abstract: Cloning Fuzzy Copy Yes or No
variable.description: fuzzycopy: Yes=source remains available, No=source stopped during copy. If Yes, then Log Apply should be enabled.

variable.name: maxSubtasks
variable.label: Max Subtasks
variable.abstract: Number of subtassks to use for parallelim
variable.description: maxSubtasks: Values > 1 can use parallelism during some phases of cloning. Parallelism will likely require more CPU for the possible benefit of redued elapsed time.

variable.name: minilogHLQ
variable.label: Log Apply Mini Logs HLQ
variable.abstract: Mini Logs HLQ for Log Apply processing
variable.description: minilogHLQ: Log Apply Mini Logs will be created with this HLQ. Used when Log Apply is enabled. Referenced in the Source job. Deleted and recreated in the Target job.

variable.name: spacesPerML
variable.label: Spaces per Minilog
variable.abstract: Db2 spaces allocated to each minilog
variable.description: spacesPerML: Defaults to 10. As the number of objects increase, consider increasing this number, reducing the number of minilogs, and therefore sorts. Cloning Tool attempts to adjust this value automatically as the number of spaces increases.

variable.name: LAenable
variable.label: Log Apply Enable Option
variable.abstract: Log Apply Enable Yes or No
variable.description: LAenable: Yes=perform Log Apply at the Target, No=do not perform Log Apply. If Yes, the Log Apply Log Point should be set (defaults to TO_CURRENT).

variable.name: LAlogpoint
variable.label: Log Apply Log Point
variable.description: LAlogpoint: The Log Apply log point for rolling forward. Defaults to TO_CURRENT.

variable.name: LAdatasharing
variable.label: Source Db2 Data Sharing Info
variable.abstract: Enter data sharing member info or *** for NULL.
variable.description: Log Apply needs Data Sharing Member info. End each line with " -". Not Data Sharing?, enter "***". Data sharingiable input file will provide a sample format of the Member #, SSID, ZPARM information. Each line must end with a " -", and all but the last member line must finish with a ",". information must be in format of "Member#,SSID,ZPARMmember - \n" (ex. "1,PCA1,PCA1PARM - \n") on each line.

variable.name: intLAdatasharing
variable.label: Internal Data Sharing Member information
variable.abstract: What will be placed in the JCL
variable.description: intLAdatasharing: REXX in the WDF (XML) will populate this value. It is not externalized.

variable.name: rtsEnable
variable.label: Statistics Copy Option
variable.abstract: Copy RTS and Catalog stats to target
variable.description: rtsEnable: This enabled the copy of staitstics from the source to the target for cloned objects. This is beneficial for target utility processing (primarily REBUILD) and proper application behavior at the clone. Work data sets will be created at the source which are needed at the target. See the rtsHLQ variable.

variable.name: rtsHLQ
variable.label: RTS copy work data set HLQ
variable.abstract: HLQ for the statstic copy data sets
variable.description: rtsHLQ: Copying statstics requires data sets for the transfer of this information. The Source job will extract stats for the objects involved into these data sets. The Target job will read these data sets to populate the appropriate target catalog tables.

variable.name: propertyFile
variable.label: Property File Path/Name
variable.abstract: Full HFS path and file name
variable.description: propertyFile: File written by the Variable Customization step to construct new variables for later steps.

variable.name: listdef
variable.label: LISTDEF Control Records
variable.abstract: Identify the Source objects for cloning
variable.description: listdef: The LISTDEF control records to chose source objects. Use the Cloning Tool UI to develop a proper set of control records.

variable.name: inclAllRI
variable.label: Include All RI
variable.abstract: Add RI keyword to all LISTDEF definitions
variable.description: inclAllRI: This will perform an exhaustive search for parents and children for all LISTDEF entries.

variable.name: explodeObj
variable.label: Explode Objects
variable.description: explodeObj: Propagate the LISTDEF objects by finding dependent objects (Views, Aliases, Routines, etc.).

variable.name: supprRIconst
variable.label: Suppress RI Contraints
variable.abstract: Controls PK and FK Constraints defined at the target
variable.description: supprRIconst: For objects that are cloned and are RI related, this determines if the ALTERs will be generated to include the PK/FK constraints at the target.

variable.name: ddlproc
variable.label: DDL PROCESS-TYPE
variable.description: ddlproc: How to handle DDL processing when cloning. Defaults to Yes. Yes=generate and execute for missing target objects. No=no DDL processing. Gen=only generate DDL for missing target objects. eXec=execute (no generation) DDL only. All=same as Gen but for all source objects.

variable.name: useDDLsqlid
variable.label: DDL SQLID
variable.abstract: An alternative SQLID for DDL statements. Use "***" for NULL.
variable.description: useDDLsqlid: Leave *** to attempt using catalog SQLIDs. SET CURRENT SQLID will be set to this value if specified.

variable.name: intUseDDLsqlid
variable.label: Internal DDL SQLID
variable.abstract: What will be placed in the JCL
variable.description: intUseDDLsqlid: REXX in the WDF (XML) will populate this value. It is not externalized.

variable.name: commitFreq
variable.label: DDL Commit Frequency
variable.abstract: Db2 spaces allocated to each minilog
variable.description: commitFreq: Defaults to 10. As the number of objects increase, consider increasing this number, reducing the number of minilogs, and therefore sorts. Cloning Tool attempts to adjust this value automatically as the number of spaces increases.

variable.name: ddlattr
variable.label: DDL-ATTRIBUTE-CHANGE
variable.abstract: DDL Name Translations. End each line with " -"
variable.description: ddlattr: These records drive the DDL-ATTRIBUTE-CHANGE for CKZ. Use the Cloning Tool UI to develop a proper set of control records. Attributes include STROGROUP, GBPCACHE, LOG, PRIQTY, SECQTY, TRACHMOD, CLOSE, DATACAPTURE, and BUFFERPOOL; and can be applied to DATABASE, TABLESPACE, TABLEPART, TABLE, INDEX, INDEXPART, or all objects. --Attribute-name,Source-attribute-or-*,Target-value-to-be-used,Target-type,Source-object-name-or-blank,--

variable.name: objxlat
variable.label: OBJECT-TRANSLATE
variable.abstract: CKZ OBJECT-TRANSLATE End each line with " -"
variable.description: objxlat: These records drive the OBJECT-TRANSLATE for CKZ. Use the Cloning Tool UI to develop a proper set of control records. Attributes include CREATOR, DATABASE, TABLESPACE, INDEX, INDECSPACE, TABLE, and VCAT; and wildcarding can be used. --Object-type,Source-name,Target-name--

variable.name: xmlDOCIDfile
variable.label: XML DOCID File (when target is data sharing)
variable.abstract: File to collect XML DOCID information from the Source to condition the target
variable.description: xmlDOCIDfile: File to collect XML DOCID information from the Source to condition the target.

variable.name: intxmlDOCIDfile
variable.label: Internal XML DOCID File
variable.abstract: What will be placed in the JCL
variable.description: intxmlDOCIDfile: REXX in the WDF (XML) will populate this value. It is not externalized.

variable.name: tgtStart
variable.label: Start Target Db2 Objects?
variable.abstract: After cloning is completed, should the target objects be started?
variable.description: tgtStart: Normally, after cloning completes, you want the target objects started (Y) to make them available. However, if the cloning is being performed to a shadow DB or CR for the purposes of having a PIT backup, then you might want to leave them stopped (N).

step.name: step0a
step.title: Prepare the required variables

step.name: step1
step.title: Clean up objects
step.instructions: Invoke the supplied stored procedure to deprovision the objects and snapshots

step.name: step2
step.title: Call Admin workflow
step.description: Call Admin workflow to execute Admin reverse engineering program

step.name: step3
step.title: Call Run SQL workflow
step.description: Call Run SQL workflow to execute the output from the previous step
step.calledWorkflowDescription: Execute the output from the previous step

step.name: step4
step.title: Call Provision Security workflow
step.description: Call Provision Security workflow to provision security

condition.description: If the parameters are not defined, then skip the step.

extendStateExpression.description: Skip if security parameters are not defined

step.name: step5
step.title: Call Cloning Tool workflow
step.description: Call CloningTool workflow to clone data
